attributes.action: Limit local bus fares for children (5-16)  to max of £1 for a single journey.
attributes.additional_details:
In Swansea a child will need to pay £3.60 for a journey of 4 miles. Day ticket adult £4.50 (on app £4.20), Child £3.60 – 1 adult and two children £11.20, family ticket £12.50.
https://www.firstgroup.com/south-west-wales/tickets/ticket-types/fare-changes-1-april-2019
Brighton, accompanied child 50p unaccompanied child £1, this encourages children  to travel more independently and families to take the bus. https://www.buses.co.uk/young-people
attributes.background: To reduce emissions more people must travel by public transport.  Bus fares for families can be very expensive and does not encourage bus use and can drive families into transport poverty. Some areas have low concessionary fares but these are not fairly distributed across the UK.
